document.masterDocTitle: A new species of Ambrysus Stål from the Central Mexican Plateau and new state records for species of the genus in the country (Heteroptera: Nepomorpha Naucoridae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A new species of Ambrysus Stål from the Central Mexican Plateau and new state records for species of the genus in the country (Heteroptera: Nepomorpha Naucoridae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Ambrysus scalenus La Rivers 1953b
: Univ. Kans. Sci. Bull., 35: 313–314.
Published records . Mexico : Estado de México , Michoacán ( La Rivers 1953b ; Reynoso-Velasco & Sites 2016a , 2018a , 2018b , 2019b ).

New state records .
Mexico : Guerrero , Oaxaca , Puebla
.

Distribution . The previously known distribution of this species included only two locations, El Sabino ( type locality in Michoacán ) and Paso de Vigas (Estado de México ). Based on the material examined for this study,
Ambrysus scalenus
is distributed exclusively in central Mexico ( Fig. 7 ). The collecting records, all below an elevation of 2000 meters, fall within the boundaries of the Balsas Basin biogeographic province; thus,
A. scalenus
apparently is endemic to this province. The highest elevation where the species has been collected is 1851 meters, in the upper section of the Balsas Basin ( Oaxaca ). There are no records of the species from Morelos , but this central state is entirely within the upper section of the Balsas Basin; therefore,
A. scalenus
most likely is present in this area.

Material examined.
